title: Ticket #1591: Update condor_unit_tests/README with new logic
description:
Commit dee67e46fdee6cb3358b9b3e06706cc2f4dd7f80 (warning, giant diff, takes a long time to load: [18531]) for #1239 changed the interface to emitter. In particular, emit_function_break no longer exists. However /src/condor_unit_tests/README was never updated to match. Do we no longer need to call emit_function_break? If so, correct the README to no longer reference it. Was it erroneously removed?

Furthermore, the README directs me to call emit_test_break after each test. However, none of the existing tests do so, making me suspect that the instructions to do so are obsolete and should be corrected.

Note: no version history entry is required for this; it is strictly internal documentation.
check_ins: 2010-Aug-27 16:42   Check-in [18894]: Updated condor_unit_tests/README to reflect current state of unit tests. #1591 (By Josh Slauson )
creator: adesmet
